subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: ok so im getting stuff on the spectergram
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
I have Audition, but loaned my monitor to daughter in-law, and Olgra very
controling when it comes to *her* computer.

 These images are the same as the ones I get in steam, towels and rugs in
the bathroom, mostly. I aslo see them in other media as well, smoke, fire,
steam, clouds, and I do not accept the suggestion that it is stupid brain
tricks.  I used to record endless hours of dark video while recording school
board meetings, the digital recorder used a hard drive to store the video
wiht a seperate sound track, no video=no sound. We were just after the
sound When I viewed the black video, it would appear to be kind of an alien
language, symbols and/or letters. Makes sense, being an alien Princess.

F-S

On Fri, Dec 17, 2010 at 11:00 PM, psi_research <vilhellm@...>wrote:

>
>
> I've seen live webcast of ITC sessions where GB output is fed directly into
> the mic line in on a computer running Adobe Audition with the spectragraph
> running. It was really compelling to see letters and numbers, not images or
> pictures, but partial words appear in the graph. At first it was I thought
> it was a software glitch but it is a repeatable event. It was on LiveSciFi
> which is run by Tim Wood, he also thought there was some kind of code error
> but it happened on more than one webcast.
>
> So if anyone has Audition, just feed Box output right in your computer and
> see what happens. I wanted to try it tonight but I have Audacity and the
> spectragraph feature doesn't have that shaded appearance that Audition does
> so it's not able to render images or characters, at least as far as I see
> using the various settings.
>
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Tim Woolworth
> <tjwoolworth@...> wrote:
> >
> > I have tried numerous EVP files and short box clips and so far
> > nothing discernible has appeared on either program. I still have a lot of
> > hope though.
> >
> > I don't know about you guys, but I am going to try to work this in to a
> > session tonight!
> >
> > Tim
> >
> > On Fri, Dec 17, 2010 at 4:23 PM, Ursula <kalinu@...> wrote:
> >
> > >
> > >
> > > But I don't know how to save the image ugh...what if i just want one
> part
> > > of it..Im soo lost here..and excited at the same time LOL
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>  
>
